revision.text:
__NOTOC__The '''XXXVI Corps''' was a [[Germany|German]] military formation in [[World War II]].
It was formed in October 1939 and took part in the [[Battle of France|invasion of France]]. In August 1940 the corps was moved to southern Norway and from there to northern [[Finland]].
It took part in [[Operation Barbarossa]] in mid-1941. It was part of the German [[Army Norway (Wehrmacht)|AOK Norwegen]] (Army Norway) and was moved to northern Finland during June 1941. The XXXVI Corps took part in [[Operation Polarfuchs]] aiming to advance through [[Salla]] to [[Kandalaksha]], and from there to [[Murmansk]].
In November 1941 the corps was renamed the '''XXXVI Gebirgskorps''' (Mountain corps).
In late 1944 the corps had to fight its former allies during their [[Lapland War|withdrawal from Finland]]. The corps was forced to retreat from Finland back to Norway. The corps stayed the rest of the war in Norway and surrendered there in May 1945.
== Commanders == * [[General|General of the Cavalry]] [[Hans Feige]] (Mai 1940 - 30 November 1941) * General of the Infantry [[Karl Weisenberger]] (1 December 1941 - 10 August 1944) * General of Mountain troops [[Emil Vogel]] (10 August 1944 - 8 May 1945)
== Area of operations ==
{| border="1" cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" align="left" !Date !Area !Subordinate to !Operations |- |October 5, 1939||[[Poland]]||OB Ost||[[Fall Weiss (1939)|Fall Weiss]] |- |June 5–30, 1940||[[France]]||[[16th Army (Wehrmacht)|AOK 16]]||[[Fall Gelb]] |- |July 3 - October 4, 1940||[[France]]||[[1st Army (Wehrmacht)|AOK 1]]||- |- |October 30 - December 19, 1940||[[Norway]]||[[Army Norway (Wehrmacht)|Gruppe XXI]]||[[Operation Weserübung]] |- |December 19, 1940 - June 22, 1942||Finland||[[Army Norway (Wehrmacht)|AOK Norwegen]]||[[Operation Polarfuchs]] |- |June 22, 1942 - April 24, 1945||Finland, [[Norway]]||[[20th Mountain Army (Wehrmacht)|GebAOK 20]]||[[Operation Birke]] |} {{clear}}
== Organisation ==
=== Formations === * [[71st Infantry Division (Wehrmacht)|71st Infantry Division]] (to August 1940) * [[212th Infantry Division (Wehrmacht)|212th Infantry Division]] (to August 1940) * [[SS Division Nord]] (from June 1941 to July 1941, transferred to [[Finnish III Corps (Continuation War)|Finnish III Corps]]) * [[169th Infantry Division (Wehrmacht)|169th Infantry Division]] * [[163rd Infantry Division (Wehrmacht)|163rd Infantry Division]] (from 1942) * [[Finnish 6th Division (Continuation War)|Finnish 6th Division]] (from June 1941 to 1942)
=== Units === * [[Panzer-Abteilung 211]] * [[Panzer-Abteilung 40]] * [[16. RajaJK]] (Finnish Border guard company) * [[26. RajaJK]] (Finnish Border guard company) * [[46. RajaJK]] (Finnish Border guard company)
